You could feel the water swaying beneath your vessel, but sun's descending light only reached you as a crimson hue.

The moment the bag was pulled off, the vibrant sight almost pierced your eyes as your irises were long used to the darkness of the thick fabric. You didn't recognise the room, but it seemed like a highborn's chamber, however much more eastern in style. You pieced the bits swiftly. This was Westeros no longer, you were in Essos.

"You can leave us." A female's voice commanded sharply, and from behind you, you heard heavy steps leaving the chamber and shutting the door. Soon, your sight came to you fully. There was a woman sitting at the edge of a large bed, pale of hair with lilac irises, which watched you eagerly. You knew who she was within a moments notice. Only your house shared those features.

"So, I believe you are the fraud." She remarked, crossing one leg over the other.
"What is this?" You urged in a furious tone. She ignored your query.
"Pretending to be a descendant of my house in order to steal my birthright. I will not let that go without punishment. Rhaegar's children are dead. You are but a mummer's dragon. "She cracked her fingers and you felt force push at the back of your knees.
